title: Luck Manipulation and the reason Riot's Average's are useless.
body:
So basically unless you have only started playing league recently you would know that Riot uses a thing called Luck Manipulation, in a lot of what they make for the Player, in the cases we have been told about, it's been things like "If you have bad luck a lot of the time, we will manipulate luck into your favor"

This has been done for things like Gemstones, and has likely also been done for these new level up capsules, but what it does, is makes Average's a thing that is basically a lie.

So generally speaking, if i give you a 50% chance of getting 6 points, and a 50% chance of getting 12 points, then on average, you are going to get 9 points.

However, if i say add a rule saying that if you get 2 6's in a row, i'll give you an 80% chance to get a 12 and a 20% chance to get a 6, what that does is effectively increase's the average without actually affecting the returns that players will normally get.

Thus we have effectively just made the average to be higher then 9 (because low luck has been mitigated) without actually affecting the REAL average, which is still just 9.

The only point that Luck Manipulation really increases the average players returns is 100's of rolls down the line, assuming that the player then turns around and gets the same in good luck, otherwise, there isn't a real effect, and the short term effects are a decreased REAL average even with a higher fake average that everyone gets told.

So just so we are 100% clear, while the "average" return on Champion Capsules on level up might be 910 BE, that is the fake Average that doesn't actually tell us a lot.
